task.title: Centering a Div
task.shortdesc: You can center a div block using margin settings in CSS. This method allows you to center an entire div block, rather than just the text inside the block.

prereq.p: You will also need to know what size (px, em, or %) you want your div block to be.

taskbody.context: To center your selected div block:

step.cmd: In your CSS style sheet, create a div element.
step.note: Don't forget to add the open bracket after the element!
step.stepxmp: It will look like this: div {
step.info: You can also use ids to specify a particular div.

step.cmd: Within the div element, create a width property.

substep.cmd: Do this by typing width: after the bracket.
After the colon, set the width property to the size of your choosing.
substep.info: Without a specific width, the div will want to take up the full space on the web page and cannot be centered.

step.cmd: Close the div element with a second bracket.
step.stepxmp: It will look like this: div { width:500px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto }
step.info: You can add other div properties to the bracketed space as well, such as background color.
